results.title: Vision. [No. 26]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Jim Strongin and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: School of the Arts; Los Angeles Freeway; fish farming with the Lummis - an Indian tgribe has mastered the science of fish-farming; frostbiting - people who sail all year round braving winter winds and temperatures; homesteading - deserted town houses are granted to citizens willing to make them liveable again; head in the stars - Ken Kulak, 12 years old, runs a planetarium and studies computer sciences and astronomy; Theater of the Deaf - a repertory company tours the world performing for deaf and non-deaf people alike.

results.title: Vision. [No. 22]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Jim Strongin and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: the work and use of the radio telescope in West Virginia; a policewoman explains her job, training and off duty life in Washington; problems of the retired and the handicapped as tackled by the Retired Senior Volunteer Program; making dolls to reflect authentic period in American history; the cleaning up of Lake Washington by the community in Seattle and the 18 acre San Diego Wild Animal Park which aims to reproduce in captivity animals which otherwise might become extinct. Narrated by Michael Tolan.

results.title: Vision in the forest
results.brief_description: Film trailer on forest fire prevention. While a family enjoys their camping trip in the forest, one of the children wanders away, and sees a vision: a cartoon character, Smokey Bear, comes alive in his fire prevention poster, and lectures on how people can befriend the forest and its wild creatures.

results.title: Vision in our valley
results.brief_description: This film discusses the economic and environmental problems of the Muskingum Watershed, which makes up 1/5 of the State of Ohio. The area was becoming more poor due to frequent floods, droughts and intensive farming. Through co-operation among various agencies, the area has become completely renewed. By explaining how this happened, the film makes suggestions for solutions to similar problems of conservation elsewhere.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: the unit circle
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Jonathon Dawson
results.brief_description: Gives an activity to determine the mathematical relationship “sine” and shows how to apply the principle of “sine” in measuring the heights of various objects.
